meanings.definition: To reverse the action of drawing.
meanings.sent1: She undrew the picture she had just drawn.
meanings.sent2: He undrew the line he had mistakenly drawn on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The artist undrew the sketch and started over.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, she undrew the incorrect stroke.
meanings.sent5: He undrew the mistake with a sigh of frustration.

meanings.definition: To pull back or retract something that was previously drawn.
meanings.sent1: The child undrew the crayon from the wall.
meanings.sent2: She undrew her hand from the painting to avoid smudging it.
meanings.sent3: He undrew the line in the sand, signaling a change of plans.
meanings.sent4: The teacher undrew the incorrect answer on the whiteboard.
meanings.sent5: They undrew the wrong path and chose a different route.

meanings.definition: To erase or remove a drawing or mark.
meanings.sent1: She undrew the doodle on the corner of the page.
meanings.sent2: He undrew the mistake on the chalkboard before anyone noticed.
meanings.sent3: The rain undrew the chalk drawings on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The eraser undrew the pencil marks effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: They undrew the graffiti from the wall to clean it up.
